title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Wednesday, 25 November 2015 - BBC News
summary: open university staff in cambridge strike over centre closure plans .
recovery operation resumes at site of new zealand helicopter crash in which cambridge couple died .
news , sport , weather and travel updates resume at 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from the cambridgeshire live team for today .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with more live news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county .
you can send us your stories and

documents.title: university of cambridge welcomes george osborne 's £ 75m for cavendish lab
text: the university of cambridge has welcomed the spending review announcement of £ 75m to `` transform '' the cavendish laboratory .
the university says the further £ 75m will `` maintain britain 's position at the forefront of physical sciences research '' .
the university 's vice-chancellor , sir leszek borysiewicz , says : this is fantastic news .
the cavendish is and will serve as a national asset , to the benefit of research both in cambridge and across the uk . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: parking fines at car parks in cambridge soar by 3,500 per cent - and five worst named
text: hundreds of drivers have been hit with fines totalling £ 25,000 for poor parking at cambridge 's five multi-storey car parks .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: weather : a little light rain or drizzle tonight , minimum temperature 4c ( 39f )
text: there will be some clear spells around , but it will be often cloudy tonight with a little light rain or drizzle .
it should just about stay frost-free .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live head to bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: america farm solar farm plan scrapped by peterborough city council
text: proposals for a solar farm at america farm , near peterborough , have been scrapped by the city council after being deemed financially unviable .
the site was part of peterborough city council 's controversial plans for a 900-acre ( 364 hectare ) renewable energy park , which it hoped would generate an income of at least £ 90m over 20 years .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: rural crime down by a third in cambridgeshire , say police
text: rural crime in the county has reduced by a third over the past year , says cambridgeshire police .
the force is holding a `` rural crime day of action '' , today focussing on hare coursing .
officers are also visiting schoolsin a police tractor to promote safetyon country roads .
author: Kerry Devine
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : £ 75m investment in cambridge lab man in critical condition after a47 wasp sting
text: here are the headlines in cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: new lease of life for 'recycled ' medieval panel
text: a rare surviving english medieval panel painting has been given a new lease of life after conservation in cambridge .
the kiss of judas , painted in about 1460 , survived the reformation because it was `` recycled '' in the 16th century , conservators believe .
it was sold to the fitzwilliam museum in cambridge in 2012 .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: train services between peterborough and ipswich resume
text: normal services between peterborough and ipswich have resumed , says abellio greater anglia .
the train company suspended services on monday after trains were damaged by leaves on the line .
normal service between ipswich and # peterborough has resumed today km
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: spending review : £ 75m to 'transform ' cambridge 's cavendish laboratory
text: george osborne has announced £ 75m for cambridge university 's cavendish laboratory in his spending review .
the chancellor said the money would be used to transform the laboratory `` where crick and rutherford expanded our knowledge of the universe '' .
author: Mousumi Bakshi
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: rugby : jamie roberts plays in annual cambridge fixture
text: wales and british and irish lions centre jamie roberts is this afternoon playing for cambridge university , where he is studying for a masters degree .
he 's playing in the annual steele-bodgers match at grange road in preparation for the varsity match against oxford on 10 december .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: watch : the private island for sale in landlocked cambridgeshire
text: private islands are a ' '' rare thing '' in landlocked cambridgeshire , says estate agent simon gooderham .
one-and-a-half-acre ( 0.4 hectare ) houghton island , in the river great ouse , is expected to fetch about £ 125,000 at auction in december .
the tree-covered island is unsuitable for living on but is a `` haven for wildlife '' .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: a47 closed after man 'stung by a wasp '
text: there is more information about the closure of the a47 at wisbech .
police say it is due to a man being `` stung by a wasp and going into cardiac arrest '' .
theeast anglian air ambulanceis at the scene .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : a47 closed at wisbech following an 'incident '
text: the a47 is closed at the junction with cromwell road in wisbech following an `` incident '' .
# a47 wisbech is closed at the junction with cromwell road due to an incident .
use alternative routes
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: new zealand helicopter crash : investigators use drone to assess crash site
text: investigators in new zealand have used a drone to assess the site of a helicopter crash which killed a couple from cambridge .
police say search and rescue teams were only able to return to fox glacier briefly today because of bad weather .
katharine walker , 51 , and her partner andrew virco , 50 , from cambridge , died with two other britons when the aircraft crashed on south island , on saturday .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: students will suffer if open university centre is closed says union
text: open university students in cambridgeshire will suffer if the institution closes its centre in cambridge , according to a union .
steve cooper , from the university and college union said students need to be able to speak to `` skilled and knowledgeable '' staff in the centres .
strikes are being held over plans to close centres in cambridge , birmingham , bristol , gateshead , leeds , london and oxford .
author: Katharine Park
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: driver bailed following fatal gamlingay crash
text: a 41-year-old man from sandy , bedfordshire , arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving , following the death of a cyclist in gamlingay , has been bailed .
he is due to return to parkside police station in cambridge on 29 january .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: football : peterborough 's gabriel zakuani set for spell on sidelines
text: peterborough united defender gabriel zakuani is set for a spell on the sidelines , after undergoing tendon surgery .
zakuani up the problem while on international duty with dr congo .
he missed posh 's 3-2 victory over barnsley last night , but manager graham westley has revealed zakuani has already started his rehabilitation .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : staying mainly dry with sunny spells
text: there will be some bright spells this afternoon with perhaps a few showers in the east .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live head to bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cyclist killed in gamlingay collision named by police
text: a cyclist who died after being hit by a van in gamlingay , has been named by police as 74-year-old ronal bousted , from potton .
the accident happened on heath road just after 06:00 yesterday .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : open university staff strike in cambridge police name cyclist killed in gamlingay crash
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire so far this morning :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: snooker : joe perry in uk championship first round action
text: chatteris snooker player joe perry begins his uk championship campaign at the york barbican this afternoon .
the fen potter is playing against thailand 's james wattana at 14:30 .
perry 's best performance at the tournament saw him reach the semi-finals in both 2004 and 2005 .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: congestion could double and traffic increase by a third - fear over growth without transport upgrade
text: traffic in the cambridge area risks increasing by more than a third in the next 15 years if we fail to get a grip on congestion now , one of the county 's top transport bosses has said .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: private island in landlocked cambridgeshire put up for auction
text: a one-and-a-half acre ( 0.4 hectrare ) private island in landlocked cambridgeshire is up for auction .

houghton island in the river great ouse , near huntingdon , is being auctioned in december as part of an eight-acre ( 3.2 hectare ) plot by a local charity , and is expected to fetch about £ 125,000 .
the tree-covered island is connected to the land by a footbridge , but is liable to flood in the winter .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: football : action-packed debut for peterborough 's miles addison
text: former derby county and blackpool defender miles addison joined peterborough united on a short-term contract last night , hours before posh played barnsley .
addison was named in the starting xi and went on to concede a penalty before scoring a header in posh 's 3-2 victory .
boss graham westley admitted that addison 's body `` will be in pieces '' this morning , after a first appearance since may .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: police hold day of action targeting rural crime
text: cambridgeshire police is holding a day of action targeting rural crime in the county .
as part of the event officers will be driving a `` highly visible '' tractor ( above ) to highlight safety on rural roads .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: peterborough-based thomas cook reports first profit in five years
text: peterborough-based thomas cook has reported a £ 50m pre-tax profit for the year to september - its first full-year profit since 2010 .
the holiday company has hailed 2015 as `` a year of real progress '' , despite what it described as a year of `` considerable challenges '' at some destinations .
it also faced criticism over its handling of the deaths of two children nine years ago from carbon monoxide poisoning at a corfu hotel .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : shaun derry up first win as cambridge united manager
text: shaun derry up his first win as cambridge united manager as his side defeated morecambe 4-2 in league two .
leon legge 's header gave the u 's an early lead , but lee molyneux finished off a fine shrimps move to level .
the u 's led 3-1 , then ben williamson made it four with his first u 's goal .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: new zealand helicopter crash : recovery operation resumes
text: police in new zealand say a recovery operation resumed briefly today at the site of a helicopter crash that killed a couple from cambridge .
andrew virco and katharine walker died with five others in the crash on the fox glacier on saturday .
bad weather has stopped recovery teams from reaching the site .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: open university staff in cambridge strike as centre closures agreed
text: open university staff in cambridge have gone on strike this morning after the institution said it would press ahead with plans to close seven regional centres .
the cambridge centre is set to close along with birmingham , bristol , gateshead , leeds , london and oxford .
the open university said the decision meant `` much-needed improvements '' could be made to student support services , which had not been possible across smaller , dispersed offices .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a chilly start but staying mainly dry , top temperature 9c ( 48f )
text: a chilly morning with a touch of ground frost , turning into a bright and sunny day for most .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : open university staff strike in cambridge new zealand helicopter crash recovery operation resumes

we 'll be here until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for cambridgeshire .
